title: Open source BI platform Lightdash gets Accel’s backing to bring AI to business intelligence
content:
Lightdash, a business intelligence (BI) platform and open source alternative to Google’s Looker, is lifting the lid on a new product that allows companies to train “AI analysts” specific to individual teams’ use-cases, enabling anyone in a company to query aggregate business data. To help, the 4-year-old startup also on Tuesday announced that it has […]

title: Revyze, a ‘TikTok for education’ startup, draws on Duolingo to add bite-sized learning too
content:
Middle and high schoolers are both the easiest and most difficult audience. If you’re developing a neat little video game, chances are they’re willing to download it right away. But if, like the team behind Revyze, you’re working on a learning app, good luck pitching them. And yet, the French startup has defied the odds […]

title: French biotech Generare speeds up hunt for new drugs by cloning natural molecules
content:
French biotech startup Generare has closed a €5 million seed round (around $5.5 million at current exchange rates) to step up development of what it touts as a highly scalable approach to identifying promising compounds for drug discovery that already exist in nature. It’s focused on sifting for molecules that are produced by microorganisms but […]

title: Chainalysis CEO Michael Gronager steps down in move described as temporary
content:
Michael Gronager, co-founder and CEO of Chainalysis, has taken a personal leave of absence from the company. The blockchain analysis outfit isn’t sharing why but says the development is temporary.   According to The Block, which first reported the news, Chainalysis President and COO Sari Granat,  who joined the outfit in 2022, is acting as interim […]

title: General Catalyst is working on a ‘continuation’ fund worth up to $1B, sources say
content:
General Catalyst, one of Silicon Valley’s largest capital firms, is gearing up to launch what’s known as a “continuation fund” worth between $800 million and $1 billion, according to a person familiar with the plans. A continuation fund consists of a portion of stakes that the VC firm has in portfolio companies. With around $25 […]

title: VC firm NFX laid off 4 employees and plans to hire more investors
content:
Venture capital firm NFX laid off four employees in September as the firm looks to “rebalance” its resources from its software and product teams to its investing team, general partner Pete Flint told TechCrunch. The layoffs included one product leader and three engineers, Flint said. About a week ago, Amy Lin, chief product officer since […]

title: Emma Watson invests in reproductive health company Hertility
content:
Actress Emma Watson has made a previously undisclosed investment into the women’s health company Hertility, bringing its total funding to more than $14 million, the company told TechCrunch in an interview on Monday. Watson is known for her interest in the environment and supporting women-led initiatives. She is a UN Women Goodwill ambassador and helped […]

title: US judge orders Google to open up Google Play to rivals
content:
A federal judge has ordered Google to open its app store to rivals and give Android users more choice when it comes to downloading apps.  Judge James Donato issued his final ruling in the Epic and Google saga on Monday, detailing how Google has to change how it operates Google Play. According to the filing, […]

title: The 30-year-old internet backdoor law that came back to bite
content:
China reportedly hacked the wiretap systems required by U.S. internet providers under a 1994 U.S. wiretapping law.

title: India regulator issues notice to Ola Electric over consumer rights concerns
content:
The Central Consumer Protection Authority, India’s consumer rights regulator, has sent a show-cause notice to Ola Electric over alleged violation of consumer rights, escalating troubles for the leading electric vehicle maker whose shares dropped 9% earlier on Monday, The notice, issued on Monday, gives the Bengaluru-headquartered firm 15 days to respond to allegations that include […]

title: Tesla’s head of vehicle programs jumps to Waymo ahead of robotaxi reveal
content:

content:

title: Fisker’s plan to make owners pay for recall repairs is illegal, DOJ says
content:
The U.S. Department of Justice says bankrupt EV startup Fisker’s plan to make owners pay for labor costs related to multiple recalls is illegal, according to a new filing. The DOJ, writing on behalf of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA), said in a filing submitted to Fisker’s bankruptcy docket Monday that the “scheme” […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
